title: Yale Names Alexander Banker as Interim Endowment Head
sub_head: Longtime endowment chief David Swensen died on Wednesday
body:
Yale University said Friday that Alexander Banker, director of investments at Yale’s endowment, would run the endowment until a successor is named for longtime endowment chief David Swensen.
Mr. Swensen, who changed the way endowments and foundations invest, died Wednesday. He was 67.
“President [Peter] Salovey will announce a process for appointing Yale’s next Chief Investment Officer. For now, Alexander Banker, Director of Investments, will direct the operation of the Investments Office, which has a seasoned senior staff built and nurtured by David Swensen,” Yale spokeswoman Karen Peart said.
Mr. Banker joined the Yale Investments Office in 1997. According to his biography on the endowment’s website, Mr. Banker “oversees risk management and capital markets activities.”
Write to Juliet Chung at juliet.chung@wsj.com
